00039 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK     1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00040 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK        (1000000000UL/HZ)

00042 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ   16384
00043 
00044 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00045 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00046 #define xnarch_user_pid(tcb)    ((tcb)->user_task->pid)

00051 struct xnthread;
00052 struct task_struct;
00053 
00054 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00055 
00056     /* Kernel mode side */
00057 
00058 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00059     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00060        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00061     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00062     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00063     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00064     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00065        - NULL for RT K threads,
00066        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00067        - current for RT US threads.
00068     */
00069 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00070 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00071 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00072 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00073 
00074     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00075     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00076     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00077     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00078 
00079     /* User mode side */
00080     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00081     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00082 
00083     /* Init block */
00084     struct xnthread *self;
00085     int imask;
00086     const char *name;
00087     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00088     void *cookie;
00089 
00090 } xnarchtcb_t;
00091 
00092 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00093 
00094     unsigned exception;
00095     struct pt_regs *regs;
00096 
00097 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00098 
00099 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((unsigned int)(fi)->regs->trap)
00100 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->regs->dar)
00101 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00102 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00103 /* FIXME: FPU faults ignored by the nanokernel on PPC. */
00104 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi)  (0)
00105 
00106 /* The following predicates are only usable over a regular Linux stack
00107  *    context. */
00108 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->exception == ADEOS_ACCESS_TRAP)
00109 #define xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi)   ((current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) && \
00110                                 ((fi)->exception == ADEOS_IABR_TRAP || \
00111                                 (fi)->exception == ADEOS_SSTEP_TRAP || \
00112                                 (fi)->exception == ADEOS_PERFMON_TRAP))
00113 
00114 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi))

00120 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00121 
00122 {
00123 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00124     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00125         return vmalloc(bytes);
00126 #endif
00127 
00128     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00129 }
00130 
00131 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00132 
00133 {
00134 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00135     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00136         vfree(chunk);
00137     else
00138 #endif
00139         kfree(chunk);
00140 }

00155                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))

00160 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00161 
00162 {
00163     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00164 
00165     rthal_load_cpuid();
00166 
00167     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00168        and always inside a critical section. */
00169     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00170     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00171     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00172 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00173     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00174     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00175     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00176                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00177                     : NULL);
00178 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00179 }
00180 
00181 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00182     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00183 }
00184 
00185 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00186                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00187 {
00188     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00189     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00190 
00191     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00192 
00193     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00194         {
00195         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00196 
00197         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00198 
00199 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00200         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00201            they don't work properly in our context. */
00202         if (cur_cpu_spec->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00203             asm volatile (
00204                 "dssall;\n"
00205                 : : );
00206         }
00207 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00208 
00209         if (!cpu_isset(smp_processor_id(), mm->cpu_vm_mask)) {
00210                 cpu_set(smp_processor_id(), mm->cpu_vm_mask);
00211         }
00212         
00213         if (cur_cpu_spec->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_SLB) {
00214                 switch_slb(next, mm);
00215         }
00216         else {
00217                 switch_stab(next, mm);
00218         }
00219         
00220         flush_tlb_pending();
00221         
00222         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00223 
00224         barrier();
00225         }
00226     else
00227         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00228         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00229 }
00230 
00231 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00232                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00233 {
00234     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00235 }
00236 
00237 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00238 
00239 {
00240     /* Empty */
00241 }

00243 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00244                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00245                                          const char *name)
00246 {
00247     tcb->user_task = current;
00248     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00249     tcb->ksp = 0;
00250     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00251 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00252     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00253     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00254 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00255     tcb->entry = NULL;
00256     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00257     tcb->self = thread;
00258     tcb->imask = 0;
00259     tcb->name = name;
00260 }
00261 
00262 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00263 
00264 {
00265     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00266     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00267     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00268     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00269 }
00270 
00271 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00272                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00273                                        void *cookie,
00274                                        int imask,
00275                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00276                                        char *name)
00277 {
00278     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00279 
00280     rthal_local_irq_flags_hw(flags);
00281 
00282     if (tcb->stackbase) {
00283         *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00284         
00285         ksp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 16) & ~0xf);
00286         *ksp = 0L; /* first stack frame back-chain */
00287         ksp = ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD; /* first stack frame (entry uses) */
00288         *ksp = (unsigned long)ksp+STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD; /* second back-chain */
00289         ksp = ksp - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE; /* domain context */
00290         tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00291         *((unsigned long *)tcb->ksp) = (unsigned long)ksp + 224; /*back-chain*/
00292         /* NOTE: these depend on rthal_switch_context ordering */
00293         ksp[18] = (unsigned long)get_paca(); /* r13 needs to hold paca */
00294         ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00295         ksp[20] = ((unsigned long *)&xnarch_thread_trampoline)[1]; /* r2 = TOC base */
00296         ksp[25] = ((unsigned long *)&xnarch_thread_trampoline)[0]; /* lr = entry addr. */
00297         ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00298     }
00299     else {
00300         printk("xnarch_init_thread: NULL stackbase!\n");
00301     }
00302 
00303     tcb->entry = entry;
00304     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00305     tcb->self = thread;
00306     tcb->imask = imask;
00307     tcb->name = name;
00308 }
00309 
00310 /* No lazy FPU init on PPC. */
00311 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task) (1)
00312 
00313 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb)
00314 
00315 {
00316 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00317     if(!current_tcb->user_task)
00318         rthal_enable_fpu();
00319 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00320 }
00321 
00322 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00323 
00324 {
00325 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00326     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00327        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00328     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00329     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00330 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00331 }
00332 
00333 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00334 
00335 {
00336 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00337 
00338     if(tcb->fpup)
00339         {
00340         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00341 
00342         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00343             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00344         }   
00345 
00346 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00347 }
00348 
00349 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00350 
00351 {
00352 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00353 
00354     if(tcb->fpup)
00355         {
00356         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00357 
00358         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00359             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00360         }   
00361 
00362     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when RTAI preempted Linux, whereas we
00363        could be much lazier. */
00364     if(tcb->user_task)
00365         rthal_disable_fpu();
00366 
00367 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00368 }
00369 
00370 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00374 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00375 
00376     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00377     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00378     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00379 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00380     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00381     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00382 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00383     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00384 }
00385 
00386 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */

00388 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE

00390 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00391                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00392                                            const char *name)
00393 {
00394     struct task_struct *task = current;
00395 
00396     tcb->user_task = task;
00397     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00398     tcb->ksp = 0;
00399     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00400 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00401     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00402     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00403 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00404     tcb->entry = NULL;
00405     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00406     tcb->self = thread;
00407     tcb->imask = 0;
00408     tcb->name = name;
00409 }

00411 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00412 
00413 {
00414     unsigned irq;
00415 
00416     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00417         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00418                              irq,
00419                              handler,
00420                              NULL,
00421                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00422 
00423     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00424        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00425        individually. */
00426 
00427     rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00428                          RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ,
00429                          handler,
00430                          NULL,
00431                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00432 }
00433 
00434 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00435 
00436 {
00437     unsigned irq;
00438 
00439     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00440         {
00441         switch (irq)
00442             {
00443 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00444             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00445 
00446                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00447                 continue;
00448 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00449 
00450             default:
00451 
00452                 rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,irq);
00453             }
00454         }
00455 
00456     rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00457 }
00458 
00459 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00460 
00461 {
00462     unsigned irq;
00463 
00464     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00465         {
00466         switch (irq)
00467             {
00468 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00469             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00470 
00471                 continue;
00472 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00473 
00474             default:
00475 
00476                 rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,irq);
00477             }
00478         }
00479 
00480     rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00481 }
00482 
00483 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00485 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00486 
00487 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00488     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00489        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00490        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00491        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks.  Since the
00492        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00493        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00494     rthal_timer_program_shot(delay);
00495 }
00496 
00497 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00498     rthal_timer_release();
00499 }

00501 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00502 
00503 {
00504 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00505     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00506 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00507     return 0;
00508 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00509 }

00511 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00513 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE

00515 #include <linux/init.h>
00516 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00517 
00518 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00519 
00520 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00521 
00522 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00523 
00524 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00525 
00526 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00527 
00528 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00529 
00530 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00531 {
00532     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00533     fltinfo.exception = event;
00534     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)data;
00535     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00536 }
00537 
00538 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00539 
00540 {
00541 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00542     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00543 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00544     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00545        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00546     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00547 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00548 }
00549 
00550 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00551 
00552 {
00553     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00554 
00555     if (!nktimerlat)
00556         return -ENODEV;
00557 
00558     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00559 
00560     return 0;
00561 }
00562 
00563 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00564 
00565 {
00566     int err;
00567 
00568 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00569     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00570        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00571     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00572 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00573 
00574     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00575 
00576     if (err)
00577         return err;
00578 
00579     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00580 
00581     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00582         return -ENOSYS;
00583 
00584     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00585                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00586                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00587                          NULL,
00588                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00589 
00590     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00591 
00592 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00593     err = xnshadow_mount();
00594 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00595 
00596     if (err)
00597         {
00598         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00599         rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00600         }
00601 
00602     return err;
00603 }
00604 
00605 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00606 
00607 {
00608 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00609     xnshadow_cleanup();
00610 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00611     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00612     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00613 }
00614 
00615 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00616 
00617 #ifdef __cplusplus
00618 }
00619 #endif
